required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Visual Outcomes After Vivity Toric IOL Implantation
clinical_study.official_title: Patient Satisfaction and Visual Outcomes After Bilateral Implantation of a Novel Non-Diffractive Extended Vision Toric Intraocular Lens

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to evaluate patient satisfaction after bilateral implantation of Vivity Toric Extended Vision Intraocular lens and visual outcomes.

detailed_description.textblock: To evaluate and report outcomes including postoperative uncorrected visual acuity, postoperative best corrected visual acuity, postoperative refractive error, and IOL rotational stability after Vivity Toric Extended Vision intraocular lens (IOL) implantation.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Subjects to receive bilateral implantation of Vivity Extended Vision Toric Intraocular Lens

primary_outcome.measure: Monocular best corrected distance visual acuity
primary_outcome.description: Monocular best corrected distance visual acuity

primary_outcome.measure: Binocular best corrected distance visual acuity
primary_outcome.description: Binocular best corrected distance visual acuity

primary_outcome.measure: Monocular best distance-corrected intermediate visual acuity
primary_outcome.description: Monocular best distance-corrected intermediate visual acuity

primary_outcome.measure: Binocular best distance-corrected intermediate visual acuity
primary_outcome.description: Binocular best distance-corrected intermediate visual acuity

primary_outcome.measure: Monocular best distance-corrected near visual acuity
primary_outcome.description: Monocular best distance-corrected near visual acuity

primary_outcome.measure: Binocular best distance-corrected near visual acuity
primary_outcome.description: Binocular best distance-corrected near visual acuity

secondary_outcome.description: Manifest postoperative refractive cylinder (measured in diopters, with a phoropter) after cataract surgery and IOL implantation.

arm_group.description: Patients with cataract that had phacoemulsification and Vivity Toric IOL implantation.

intervention.description: The U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) has granted approval of Alcon's Vivity Toric Extended Vision intraocular lens (IOL) for cataract patients. This innovative lens is an extended depth of focus IOL that has been reported to result in fewer visual disturbances than diffractive IOLs.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Calculated lens power within study IOL range of 15.0 diopters to 25.0 diopters and toric range of T3 to T6
- Willing and able to comprehend informed consent form and to complete 1 day and 3-4 month postoperative visit
- Potential postoperative best corrected distance visual acuity of 20/20 or better in each eye based on medical opinion of investigator
Exclusion Criteria:
- Ocular pathology or comorbidity that could reduce potential postoperative best corrected distance visual acuity
- Ocular trauma or zonular weakness/instability
- Diagnosis of glaucoma or high-risk glaucoma suspect
- Previous refractive surgery
- Unreliable preoperative biometry measurements
- Severe dry eye or ocular surface disease
